website_summaries.verdict: A good professional-level alternative with large buttons and a rugged build for extra durability.
pros: Dedicated app provides information in a clear way
Easy to navigate the various options and settings
Compatible with most modern cars with a OBD2 port
cons: The interface provides little help in figuring out specific error codes and how to fix them

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my 2005 Honda Accord.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon keeps deleting my review. That's OK, I'm posting it on Facebook along with the nice story how Amazon is bribed to delete critical reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save Me $1,000
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely excellent device. It has already saved me over $1,000. I had a repair shop telling me I needed a new transmission. I bought this scan tool, downloaded a free app (there are many), and saw that the only significant transmission code was a faulty turbine speed sensor. I replaced the sensor myself for $25 and the transmission behaves like new. I've had other bluetooth OBDII scan tools, and this is the only one that actually works. And the company stands behind it completely. I am impressed not only with the device, but also with the company, whose owner contacted me directly just to see if I was satisfied. I am.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Earle

customer_reviews.title: Works very nicely -- especially good for monitoring transmission temps while towing
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. It gives my 1999 F150 several gauges I wanted for towing. Specifically, I now have cylinder head temperature, coolant temperature, transmission temperature (at two different locations), and torque converter slip. These are the critical gauges for towing a load close to the manufacturer's max tow limit. So far, can't get engine oil temperature -- will keep trying. It does not run the battery down in any noticeable way when the truck is left sitting for a week with the Scan Tool installed. The scan tool seems to go to sleep after a while and only reawakens when the truck is started. Works well with the Android program "Torque"
customer_reviews.author: Martha Calkins

customer_reviews.title: I know I had car issues but not to this ...
customer_reviews.text: I know I had car issues but not to this extent. I was able to track down every issue (7) and figure out what it was gonna cost me. Literally saved me $700 from what the shop was gonna charge me to fix them. Makes me wonder if they were trying to rip me off
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would like my money back since they " promise our OBDII ...
customer_reviews.text: The product did not work. The company replaced it, but it didn't work either. Now I am out $21.99 because I sent both back to BAFX and have not received a refund. I would like my money back since they " promise our OBDII reader to work on ALL vehicles purchased in the USA model year 1996 or newer! WARRANTY - 2 YEAR WARRANTY (YES, 2!) " My car is a 2002. Not only did it not work, it messed up my phone as well. I would like compensation.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis K.

customer_reviews.title: Plugs in but doesn't stay engaged
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased an older version of this in the past and had no problems with it, however, this one I can't even use. It plugs into the OBDII plug with no issues, but does not stay engaged to the plug. If you hold the unit while pushing it it will work, but as soon as you let it go it pushes out just enough to disengage and stop working. I tried this on three other vehicles and had the same issue on all of them. I will be looking for a different option. It's a shame because the first one I bought a few years ago worked great and I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use this before you head to the Oregon Emissions Station and save yourself from failing and having to come back.
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't used this since 2013; at which time my phone was the issue. Hooked it up to my Nexus 6P with Android 'O' (I am developer), synced and was immediately able verify that my sensors were indeed "ready," which if I had done this before I went to the Oregon Emission Station, I would have avoided having to come back since I was not aware if you have a discharged car battery it wipes out all previous sensing data, which had to accumulate again over period of time the car is running, which I guess 40 minutes was not long enough. :( App used in the screenshot is 'Torque Pro'
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Balzer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Great for tracking intermittent problems
customer_reviews.text: I had a truck with a odd problem that was throwing random codes. This thing became my best friend. Truck would intermittently fall into “Low Power Mode” due to hard to track down problem. I could pull over, record the code, and then clear the code and be on my way. After tracking the codes for a while and doing some research, I was able to find out it was rust around the wheel speed sensor. Mechanic didn’t even believe me because most of the codes where throttle body position sensor or cylinders not firing. New wheel hub sorted it out though. Compatible app is free on Android, like most other apps on Apple it costs $
customer_reviews.author: target.Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Ford 7.3 Powerstroke diesel.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with Torque Pro and an Amazon fire tablet on my '02 Excursion 7.3 to monitor trans temp, HPOP, boost, etc. Info delay is pretty short, about the same as any of my scanners when used on various cars. Warning: These tablets are 'locked' to only accept Amazon apps so it has to be 'hacked' to accept Torque. I didn't know this when I bought it, fortunately there were easy instructions I found online. For only $29 it was worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley E Simms

customer_reviews.title: Essential
customer_reviews.text: I had my OBD2 scanner for a while now, and I've begun to take it for granted. Using the Torque app, I can see everything the sensors report, as well as pull codes. This is kind of a necessity for me, as my car actually doesn't have some of the more common gauges. I bought it as a peace-of-mind purchase, and having 5 cars in my immediate family, everyone benefits. Torque also runs on a chromebook, so I use that if I want bigger gauges.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Kollipara

customer_reviews.title: BAFX Bluetooth OBDII Reader/Scanner for Android Devices
customer_reviews.text: I have used code readers before but this one I believe is the best. Being able to view the real-time readings on a larger screen is very helpful. Also the convenience of not being tied to a wire makes it more practical as you can move around within or outside of the vehicle. The feature to search the error codes on the internet is a big help in trouble shooting problems. Being able to save your readings and have multiple vehicle profiles is a nice feature. I chose to use the Torque Pro app on my Android tablet but there are other apps that have similar features.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Works well with the 3rd Party applications
customer_reviews.text: The OBDII Reader/Scanner plugged in easily, made a quick Bluetooth connection with my S8, and was read by the 3rd party application of my choice. Some people like the length of cable between the ODBII plug and the actual reader, some do not. I am one who does. One excellent thing this reader has is an on/off switch on the cable. I don't have to remove and replug when I want to use it. Suggested improvement would be website space dedicated to telling me what sensors my car has or doesn't have. Not sure if the ODBII reader or whatever application I'm using is actually picking up everything my car actually is reporting.
customer_reviews.author: Left Handed Dataslave

customer_reviews.title: Useful OBDII reader has Bluetooth comm to cell phone.
customer_reviews.text: I found this OBDII reader to be easy to use and very useful. Basically it reads your vehicles fault codes like any OBDII reader but the Bluetooth functionality allows connection with your cell phone. Using one of the suggested apps (I used Torque Pro from Google Play Store, $5 ), you can get all kinds of information, like immediate readout and explanation of the fault code , plus other features if you need them. I got the extension cable that allows the device to be placed on the dash and remain connected for normal driving if desired. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lancerman

customer_reviews.title: Works Like A Charm
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve ever made a trip to the shop because the “check engine” light came on, you may have noticed that the shop charges around $100 just to give you the fault code and what it means. There are several epitaphs that go along with the price; the solution was an OBDII Reader. I liked this one because I can use it with my phone. I downloaded Piston on the recommendation of a mechanic and have never looked back. The first time your “check engine” light comes on it has paid for itself; not to mention a quid pro quo opportunity when the light comes on with family and friends. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: The Chief

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny. Use it on my cars and my friends cars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tool for the basic mechanics like myself. I do my own repairs and having this saves me from running to auto parts and having them read my codes. And for the price can't be beat. I used the free app first then went to the paid app. Both work great, highly recommend. Read and erase codes. Lots of other data can be read. Worth the money for entry level.
customer_reviews.author: Estevan

customer_reviews.title: No more trips to O'Reilly's for MIL! (Engine light)
customer_reviews.text: I use the torque (lite) app. This thing works great! On my Acura, I had to turn the car on. On my Nissan, the key just has to be in the "on" position. I don't know. The point is that you may have to play with it to get it to work. Also - my phone doesn't show that the bluetooth is connected to anything, but the app will show it when it connects. You can figure it out if you play with it for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Havard

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with Torque Engine Management app and it works great! Once you learn to work around the app you can really get some detailed info and can leave it plugged in to see how your vehicle is doing while you drive. I've helped several friends find out what was wrong with their vehicles. HIghly recommend this if you like to trouble shoot your own car and do your own repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Brad C

customer_reviews.title: Works great and it has already saved me some money!
customer_reviews.text: The bluetooth OBD-II reader is definitely cool, and there are lots of free apps that make it easy to see what's going on under the hood ... and for a few dollars, you can get some even better apps. Coincidentally, within a couple weeks of receiving it, my truck started running very rough, so I put the OBD-II reader to the test. It came up with code P0303, and after a quick Google search, I was able to replace the ignition coil on cylinder #3, and now it runs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Overall very happy
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used this OBDII reader for almost 2 months now and have been very happy. I use it in conjunction with the Torque App and it is great to be able to see live data as I'm driving. It even read engine codes that Autozone/O'Reilley's could not read. I would highly recommend it. You can't beat the price and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Athanassov

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I had originally received one as a gift ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I had originally received one as a gift from Groupon. It looked exactly the same, however it didn't work on my vehicle. I was a little skeptical about whether this unit would work since my vehicle was built in Canada, so I asked. The seller responded within an hour or two and guaranteed it would work for my vehicle. I plugged it in and it registered immediately. It's a great product that (with additional free software) allows you to see more of what's going on with your engine as well as view and reset error codes. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Howell

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use. Worked great on my Prius
customer_reviews.text: I used the BAFX OBDII Reader to diagnose an issue with my Prius battery. I downloaded the Torque (lite) App to try it out. When that worked as expected, I then downloaded the full Torque App program so that I could download the Prius gen 2 profile. Everything worked as expected and I was able to view my Prius battery cell voltages and find a low cell. I ended up replacing the bad cell at a pittance compared to the full cost of a Prius battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2002 Ford F150 and thru code for too lean after changing out old spark plugs... it figures! Bought this item and paid $4.95 for 3rd party smartphone app to read codes and monitor engine perf / specifics. All good now and was able to delete / clear ECM. Trk runs great and I monitor engine health with this worthwhile gadget. All in, abt $28.00. I recommend. Fingers / toes crossed going forward.
customer_reviews.author: joseph grossman

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: For under $25 you can read a lot of data you can't get from the gauges on the dash besides being able to read and clear codes. I've had a cabled model from a different vendor for a long time which was 6x the price and this gives me more info and is wireless to boot. I just need to get someone else to drive the EOS so I can play with the settings and setup a dash gauge set on my tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reader for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to troubleshoot a check engine light on my wife's 2008 Toyota Tacoma that we just purchased. With it I was able to pull the code and do a little research, then cleared it since it was probably a false alarm. Success! This also came in handy when my own vehicle's check engine light came on and I was able to determine it was a transmission problem.
customer_reviews.author: Magus Zeal

customer_reviews.title: Better than Pi at solving problems.
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for the buck. I use it on all my cars from my 2014 Mercedes to my 2004 F150. It saves me lots of headaches since I live out in the country and it's not convenient to run into town for a check engine light or to view all the diagnosis data ....wish I had it ten years ago! I found it to be accurate ... Informative and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: NotWesLan

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This product has been great. I use it with the torque pro app on my phone for codes and to watch live diagnostics. There are some really neat features in the app that work with this scanner to check fuel efficiency and more. I was even able to find a faulty throttle position sensor code with this scanner and app that my OBDII car scanner didn't find since there wasn't an engine light on. Overall I'm very satisfied and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jerred A Fain

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about 20 months ago (Jan 16) and it does work well. I use it with the Torque app. Diagnoses codes, will do a Google search for some, you can do your own for your particular car, clears code if no longer active. Saved me lots of $$$ for my 2003 BMW 325i throwing random faults that did not stick around. Diagnosed faults for my daughter's Civic hybrid battery and saved me from buying a new $3k battery when the 12v one was at fault and she simply wasn't driving it enough. Also works with Leafspy app on my new (used) Leaf.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Jaguar OBD@ Basic setting
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works great out of the box. Clear instructions and easy to pair with Android and Torque Pro. Price is very reasonable and warranty period is exceptional. Would recommend this unit to my friends. Works with Nissan & Toyota also.
customer_reviews.author: kstev

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I liked it was easy to use and worked great with the recommended app for my android tablet. I get a pesky Check Engine light from time to time on my F150 pickup, it is almost always a problem with the Mass Air Flow Sensor. With the BAFX reader I verified the problem, cleaned the MAFS myself, reset the code and saved money from not paying a mechanic to do it. I'm sure it will save me more bills in the future.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. M.

customer_reviews.title: Works. Unit is LARGE! Wish I would have also bought an extension cable.
customer_reviews.text: Advice.... Identify the location of your vehicle's obdii connector. The unit may be too large to sit in that location for real-time monitoring. If that's what your iso (in search of), you might consider an extension cable. Main vehicle for this device has obdii right next to foot parking brake. I need to be careful till I get an extension cable. Works as advertised on : 03 Nissan xterra 05 ford escape Samsung tablet running a version of the torque app. Fwiw connected to LG g3 with no issues. Connected via bluetooth using pw in booklet with no issues. I will recommend this to anyone thinking about it. Above advice included...
customer_reviews.author: Sean G.

customer_reviews.title: Basic code pulling device not good for real time monitoring
customer_reviews.text: good for Pulling codes one time. Tried it on all 5 of my cars. It connected and was able to read Trouble codes, give them names and erase them. Does not work more than 5 minutes on my 2007.5 dodge diesel. Same results on my 2009 Altima Hybrid. Will give codes but no monitoring. No ABS codes either. Basically it only works for the main computer and for DTC codes.I was really hoping that it would do monitoring in conjunction with the Torque App. So will go buy the higher priced one. Just be aware of that when you purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mayhew

customer_reviews.title: Shipped and worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: The product worked as advertised. I was very happy with the experience would purchase from these guys again. The only problem was with the downloadable app. Once installed it was hard to get it to shut off in the background. Once I was able to navigate the app no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dain J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Saved me $800. Knowledge is power. Arm yourself...first.
customer_reviews.text: Saved me $800. Everyone should own one of these tools. My mechanic said I had several issues with my engine, but this device proved it was not true. I purchased this and used the FREE android app, not the one for purchase, and I sailed thru inspection. Plus, my mechanic knows I will check his recommendations. I get a huge discount now. You must buy and run diagnostics before you get inspected. Then you will know if the inspection center is legit. Knowledge is power. Arm yourself...first.
customer_reviews.author: Wind Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Just plain works
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these units, one on west coast, one on east coast. The unit sometimes takes a few tries the first time to pair correctly, but I think this is more the android issue than the BAFX unit. Good price, gives you the ability to do simple things like clear codes and detect what's wrong - to pairing with the apps that let you nerd out. Just plain works.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bennington-Davis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the wrong product so I had to go buy a cheap android phone but it Works perfectly as described on my f250 was able to monitor my boost egt fuel pressure etc with out having to buy a fancy tuner plus it read the codes like it said and I was able to go buy the 3 dollar part to fix it used it on friends and family vehicles to help with their codes as well
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: all relevant data displays on Torque just fine. It is a little big in size but ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well when it works. Connects to the Android head unit with no issues, all relevant data displays on Torque just fine. It is a little big in size but that's a small inconvenience. I have it hooked up to my Ford Expedition SSV (Special Service Vehicle - former police car) The reason for 3 stars, is that Torque keeps losing connection to the unit. Every minute or so the feed will interrupt, and Torque goes on search mode. Torque finds the OBDII reader, connects then after another minute connection drops and the search starts again. I know it's not the head unit because it can maintain a solid bluetooth connection to my phone for calls or audio streaming.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kolonja

customer_reviews.title: Great for every car
customer_reviews.text: One of the frustrations in owning a car is the "Check Engine" light. With this product and your android phone you can get a quick diagnosis of the problem. I had purchased expensive readers in the past but never had it available when the dreaded light came on. Great product and easy to use. The first unit we received did not work but we were sent a replacement quickly and it was easy to use. Great product to have at this price in every car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this OBDII scanner / dongle
customer_reviews.text: Having vehicles ranging from 1997 to 2015, I found that the cheaper, smaller and more compact Bluetooth OBDII dongles are not compatible with all vehicles. This one however has worked flawless with any OBDII compliant vehicle that I have tried it on, it works as well or better than the hardwired scanners I've used with my laptop or computer Paired with Torque Pro Android app makes an awesome combination. Highly recommend this over the others
customer_reviews.author: Relentless

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to do
customer_reviews.text: Shows more error codes than retrieving them directly from the vehicle, and works well with apps to provide useful information. Helped me diagnose a loose gas cap and avoid an embarrassing and expensive trip to the shop. You may want to try several apps though, to find the one that works best for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Works Awesome... Will buy another soon
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to use this along with the android app Torque Pro. This is not a cheap ebay piece. I had an ebay piece for about two months before it quit working. I've already surpassed that time with this one and this one works awesome. Ebay ones also use the same BT mac ID so you can't use them in close proximity to each other. This one does not have that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Alton

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: My check engine light came on with no obvious issues. I did not want to pay the dealer $80 to find something simple so I ordered the OBDII. Super glad I did. It helped me determine the issue and resolve it myself. I saved hundreds of dollars by not having to go to the dealer for a diagnostic and then falling for an expensive dealer fix like a chump. And now I have a great diagnostic tool and some other auto tools to boot and it still cost less than the dealer, just a bit of time and effort, well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Meacham

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised/works great.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great value for your money. This replaces an ODBII scanner that I previously purchased, and does much more (for much less money). Downloaded an app for $5 and I was able to read diagnostics from all my cars. Simple to use and provides a lot of information. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It just didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to give this product a horrible review. My Android phone just does not want to see the OBDII reader. The instructions were clear, and it did everything it said it would do when I plugged it in, however I was never able to get it to connect to my phone. I want to keep this review neutral, and remind everyone this is not the fault of the seller, in fact it arrived quickly and was well packaged. It just didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve hydrogen

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: I'm an android user and this paired with my galaxy s8+ with no problem at all. I was able to install the software, plug in the unit and get a reading almost instantly. This was a quick and very easy to use product to diagnose the issues I was having with my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: pjflyercp

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my fault codes no problems!
customer_reviews.text: Fixed my fault codes no problems! Just remember to follow the instructions for bluetooth to the letter, oh and turn the engine over for the device to work. I down loaded the bluetooth app "Torque Lite (OBD2 & Car)" and it is free! Very happy. :-) . I bought this extension  to go with it. Vehicle is: BMW 528i year 2000.
customer_reviews.author: Spoonman01

customer_reviews.title: So it looks like I'll be sending this back
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this to work on my 2012 Honda CR-V. My Samsung S8 could see the OBDII Bluetooth device, and connected using the default password (1234). But both the Torque & Dash Commander apps could not connect to the analyzer, kept getting no device. I did try going into the settings and making sure that Bluetooth device and was enabled, and the correct device selected. We spent about an hour or so trying suggested tips, but to no avail. So it looks like I'll be sending this back, apparently doesn't seem to work with my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: NJPete61

customer_reviews.title: Handy little gadget. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: On the basis of pure utility & convenience, this has to be one of the best purchases I have made on Amazon. Awesome little gadget - does everything it's advertised to do and has saved me a trip to the mechanic shop a few times. I was able to diagnose more than 1 of my vehicles and handle the problems myself. And I can monitor so many functions, especially coolant temps when the sending units can become unreliable. I feel so smart now! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: nc0gnit0

customer_reviews.title: Live data good product
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews for product though I did write long positive review for this product only to have it rejected by Amazon. (I included a recommendation for a companion app to allow the live data. I am not affiliated with the app or the ODBII). Suffice it to say I like the product and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: It Did What It's Supposed To
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the device twice, but both times it did what it was supposed to. This is much more convenient than driving to the local car shop to get the codes read and having them reset the annoying "Check Engine" light on my wife's car due to the pollution control switch.
customer_reviews.author: Evil Kumquat

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: Comes with well written ENGLISH instructions. Very plug and play. I used the free Torque Lite app to read my diagnostic code and clear it. I can see the paid Torque App has some great benefits with this device and would allow you to do a lot more. The bluetooth pairing was flawless. There are plenty of other android apps that would probably work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Bussell

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this device as a replacement for the Automatic device. This device works very well and not locked into just one or two apps. You can use it with many apps. Love it! It was easy to setup and enjoy using it with my favorite app.
customer_reviews.author: John Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Not useful as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: The item was very scuffed up as if it was returned. It did work however with the Torque Pro app. BAFX should make their own app because I think the Torque Pro app's interface sucks. It needs to be easier to read, better organized, more self explanatory. There's a plethora of information that's either inaccurate or not supported. You can always stop by your local auto parts store and have them scan/clear your codes for free...
customer_reviews.author: Monique Holland

customer_reviews.title: BAFX ODBII 34t5 reader
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the with this BAFX scan tool. I have had the occasion to use it on several different cars and it performs great. I purchased the Torque App as a companion to the device. The bluetooth is strong enough that I can still stay attached to my vehicle while inside the house. I also had enough foresight to purchase the extension ribbon cable and glad I did. Great purchase at a great price for a gadget that does what it says it can.
customer_reviews.author: Bingo Bill

customer_reviews.title: Worth the premium over the chinese ELM knockoffs.
customer_reviews.text: A little larger and more expensive than the chinese ELM237 knockoffs but worth it. Considerably higher build quality and internal components. Don't look any further than this for your ODBII -> bluetooth adapter. I keep this plugged in 24/7 and if the extra length over the broken chinese elm adapter this replaced were an issue I would have negated 1 star. Since that length does not currently change my ability to keep in plugged in, it's worth all 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product for the $, but BE SURE TO UNPLUG IT
customer_reviews.text: I drive a Prius Prime 100 miles highway every day and I use this product to verify MPG and give me instant feedback on all the insane computer read-outs, particularly engine coolant temperature and RPMs. Using DashCommand, this product is really fun ans impressive for the $$$. One caveat: make sure you unplug it when you shut off your car bc it stays "on" as long as it's plugged into the OBD2.
customer_reviews.author: Talkinator

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I like that it works! Secondly, it was easy to use. Fortunately I've only needed to use it twice, but it has saved me driving 2 hrs to the dealer and back for a minor issue that could wait until the next visit, plus a half day of waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You'll need more
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a bait and switch product. It did connect to blue tooth without a problem. The product works for the less than minimum needs. They tell you to download Torque "light" to see if you like the device. Then if you want to use the device as intended you have to purchase another $12 or so in additional applications from Play Store. KIND OF LIKE ORDERING A STEAK FOR $18 AND THEN HAVING TO PAY FOR THE KNIFE AND FORK FOR ANOTHER $12 . I ordered a reader that came with my needs.
customer_reviews.author: ML Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Don't be cheap and buy the crappy ebay scan tools
customer_reviews.text: Don't be cheap and buy the crappy ebay scan tools, they won't work, or will fail quickly. This one is reliable, and doesn't fail. Do it right the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Doc_Saevio

customer_reviews.title: Only an off button away from perfection.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and works perfectly with my Android LG G5 phone and OBD Fusion (which I highly recommend) in my '17 GMC Canyon diesel. The only nit pick I have is I would like to have an off button as I do not use it all the time when I drive. I remove it instead, no big deal but some other units do sport off buttons. Would buy this unit again though, it seems to be the best of the breed. Well made, works great, solid construction. It is not exactly a big deal to pop it in and out as needed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Love this gismo!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this reader! New to this technology, (old school backyard mechanic) but the learning curve is short. Downloaded OBD Fusion software to my phone and have saved potentially $1000 in mechanic fees already by doing my own repairs. Easily paid for itself many times over.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Wish it had an On/Off switch for my application.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to monitor transmission temperatures on my 2008 FJ Cruiser as I will be towing a Casita trailer. It had no issues connecting with my Samsung G4 phone. Using an application called "Torque" and two vehicle specific PIDs to calculate transmission temperatures, I'm in business. Since the scanner derives power from an always hot OBD II port pin it's continuously transmitting, and could, over time, pull ones battery down if left plugged in thus the wish for an ON/OFF switch.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Look for a better product. This one is being sold with a known Bluetooth connectivity issue.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money like I did. I tried this on 3 different cars and it didn't supply any information except a menu. Pairing with BlueTooth is almost impossible and requires numerous attempts. Once paired You can get to the menu. Select preferences to set this up and you are greeted with a list of items, the second one on the list is "BlueTooth" bug warning. Obviously the manufacturer is well aware of Bluetooth issues with this product. The included software is on a mini DVD which is useless since for using with an iPad or Android tablet. The software that does work "Torque Lite" is available for Android. But that still doesn't resolve the BlueTooth issue.
customer_reviews.author: DanC

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and understand the basics
customer_reviews.text: I spent a couple bucks and went with Torque, figured the cost was mute. Really handy code reader and simple to work/understand. I haven't got into the technical stuff it can do yet but have played with it in realtime and that makes it worth every penny. Can't wait to check out the quarter mile results...
customer_reviews.author: Gramps

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: This saved me a lot of time and probably a little money over a silly mistake. (gasoline cap not fully tightened). Overall, the unit is well constructed, and paired with my phone easily. Software (free version of Torque) worked flawlessly, at least for what I needed. It appeared to have a great deal more features. But yeah, not having to waste an afternoon at a dealership, or waiting in an autoparts parking lot for a disgruntled employee to take pity on you and read the code? Priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk T. Morger

customer_reviews.title: After returning two other adapters, I got this one ...
customer_reviews.text: After returning two other adapters, I got this one, and it works with my 2001 Isuzu Rodeo. Other adapters claim compatibility with all obd2 compliant vehicles but this one was the cheapest I could find that actually worked with my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson Rezner

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my Ferrari 360 had a check engine light. My current 250$ reader couldn't get the codes, after some forum digging, I found that the Ferrari code reader is 3800$, which is insane. One of the members suggested this product and I was extremely sceptical, especially considering the price difference and the type of vehicle. I got the product and downloaded the suggested app. I purchased the pro version app for 5 bucks. I plugged it in, paired to it and within seconds had my codes :D. I am so excited by this result that I came here to write the review. Fantastic device.
customer_reviews.author: Musashi867

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to diagnose check engine light on my vehicle, error code said bank 2 sensor 1 was bad, changed that sensor, problem fixed, got inspection!
customer_reviews.author: Dachshund Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have actually been using this Bluetooth OBD2 everyday for a year connected to my Asus tablet running the Dash command program in my Supercharged Chevy Cobalt SS. Only times it hasn't functioned had been about 3 days this summer that were over 100 degrees outside and the reader had been installed all day itha hot car. As soon as it could be cooled down it kicked on and worked great....no need to spend $100 or more spend the $22 on this and spend the $20 for the Dash Command program and you have all you will need
customer_reviews.author: DV6

customer_reviews.title: So far good for JDM vehicles
customer_reviews.text: Works with Windows Phone also ODB Doctor also connects to my 2013 JDM Subaru Impreza Japan protocol. Also tested on other JDM Nissans and Toyota. Used with Torque Lite and got a Transmission Solenoid error code. Also some historic O2 Sensor readings. Both apps have decent dashboard in their free state, I will shop now for the better ( paid) ODB2 App.
customer_reviews.author: Wackiedon

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Advertising
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product before buying my car to run a diagnostic. However, I was shocked that the instructions stated that it can be used by dealers to "ERASE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT!" I think this represents a very bad business practice and is borderline fraudulent. Savvy, educated consumers like me buy this product to avoid being scammed by car dealers, but this product helps them to deceive the public. I returned it and would give it a 0 rating. It's "giftable" to shade tree mechanics or shady used car dealers.
customer_reviews.author: ZaziJams

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our Fords so also got the FORScan app for android $6.00. Had to remove all other Bluetooth devices before it would sync. Big whoop, take a couple of seconds to pair the others. Once that's done, syncs up fine. All the information is there in FORScan and reset the minor issue in seconds. Love it! Terrific amounts of information delivered for FORScan to display. Now that I have it, I can't imagine not having it.
customer_reviews.author: John Hecht

customer_reviews.title: Loose Fit but functional..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a family member, i used it first for a while and my biggest gripe was i had to use a rubber band to keep it connected to the OBD terminal because if its not pressed in firmly it doesn't seem to want to keep a connection, and the Data speed over BT is slow updates 1 time a second (compared to my cheaper ODB 2 BT Dongle which was capable to do high speed data and update in almost real time compared to this one) its a good value just make sure you can make sure it stays plugged in firmly..
customer_reviews.author: L. Rosa

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: WOULD NOT RECCOMEND!! Bought this for my 2006 Acura TL and many other cars that I own and couldn’t even get it to connect to my phone. Now I am not a technology newbie so I know everything about connecting everything it just would not pop up I even unpaired every other device on my phone. It feels very cheap I mean it is $25 but it feels like it should be three dollars because it feels like you literally can break it with your hand. It also will not plug all the way into the slot I have had many engine scanners and this is the first I’ve had problems with WOULD NOT RECCOMEND
customer_reviews.author: JustinBeBustin

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner for the Do it yourselfer
customer_reviews.text: I have used several Bluetooth scanners that worked well on Japanese and Domestic cars but I ended up purchasing this one because of its compatability with European cars that typically require unique scanners to interface with the vehicles computer. I use it in conjunction with torque pro and have had zero issues reading codes on 20+ cars of all makes models and years. I highly recommend this scanner. If you use it only once it's still cheaper than having a mechanic run codes for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!.... for about 4 or 5 connections
customer_reviews.text: This adapter worked FLAWLESSLY with my F250 6.0 and the Torque Pro app.... Sadly it only worked flawlessly 4 or 5 times. Bluetooth is visible from my phone now but is not connectable. The adapter is dead. When plugged in it runs through the cascading christmas tree sequence then nothing. KOEO nothing KOER nothing. Just dead. Innova reader still connects but it is no where near the torqued app... Buy with caution as it will only work for a season. Son has an F250 and his adapter did the same. His truck is heavily modified so I figured that could have been what killed his. Turns out the product has a very short lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: B.C.

customer_reviews.title: What does it all mean?
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what all the data means but I was searching for something to tell me about my fuel mixture since my gas mileage dropped by 50%. I replaced all my sensors and the plugs and no improvement at all. This device didn't come with a manual or problem guide. It's very impressive on my phone app though.
customer_reviews.author: WSW

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This works fantastic, easy to install and work with. The system monitors several key components such as; fuel trims, engine temp, rpm, service codes, many pending codes etc. No problems like others have mentioned (not sure what they are squaking about). Install the latest app and make sure your computer system is patched and up to date. The app is very easy to read using dial gauges reporting everything in real time and very easy to read. I put in on a Jaguar XJ8 and use a Windows tablet and it is very easy to monitor while driving or just reviewing data in the driveway. Well worth the money, just get it you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BeemerBikerMan

customer_reviews.title: Saved me some money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased OBDII scanner, installed in my car, it told me both my O2 sensors failed at the same time, ordered sensor 1 from Amazon, sensor 2 purchased locally, total for both sensors, 22mm wrench, and OBD scanner was about $190. Estimated I saved $1100. Then I cleared my error codes with the the OBDII scanner and the free software. The OBDII scanner gives me a better AVG mpg readout, plus lots of information. I will never drive without my BAFX OBDII scanner, ever again.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: Only buying a paperweight
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize you had to buy the software to make this device worth it . Maybe if they upped the price and just included the software it would make more sense , but they went the more scummy route and bait people into buying the device and then realize they have to get the software for more money to even get much use out of the product . Sadly this is one thing I REALLY should have returned , just didn't have the time as I was punching in 70+ hours at work at the time and still only bother with returns rarely . Just thinking about me giving money to this sort of business model is infuriating .
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: MAGIC !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is MAGIC, I have a 2012 GLI, literally took me 5 minutes to download the Torque app pay $5 for the app on my phone, entered info for my car, plugged it in my car and boom, it read me the codes and engine vitals. Pretty cool and simple. I am able to look at the codes registered on my car and clear them, even the misfire codes. Saved me a trip to the dealer and now I am better informed as to the performance of my car.
customer_reviews.author: JJV

customer_reviews.title: Worked to unlock radio backup camera on Jeep Wrangler unlimited
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple days ago. For my 2014 Jeep Wrangler unlimited. Was looking for a solution to turn on the backup camera on the stock navigation/radio. I used the app J-scan along with this. Did cost me another 22 bucks to license my vehicle with the app but it worked within ten minutes of me taking out of the box. Super thankful I picked this up. Apparently the obd2 sense is compatible with other 3rd party apps as well. I'm looking forward to seeing what other capabilities it has on my other vehicles. For more tho I'm more than happy with the fact that it unlocked my backup camera.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Vassar

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly vs Agate and other cheaper knockoffs
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly coupled with Torque Pro on the Nexus 7 in my 2002 GMC Yukon XL. Connected to BT without issue and under 60 seconds in Torque it had made all 3 connections. Added a few widgets and they are all working wonderfully. Don't waste time and money on the agate and other cheaper knockoffs. For $23 this is the one to have. Be warned, it's not the mini so make sure you have room for it. On my SUV it sticks out under the steering hub and all lights are visible, which is nice to have a visual reference.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Adams

customer_reviews.title: Works w/ 2014+ Lexus IS 250 F-Sport and a 2010+ Audi S4
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a 2015 Lexus IS 250 F-Sport and a 2010 Audi S4. In both vehicles they were both detected with no issues. This device was then paired to my phone so I could use it with the popular app TORQUE. It showed me quite a lot of information about the cars. Recommended so you can see error codes without going to the dealership.
customer_reviews.author: Thang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Very very nice product
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Must have an app like Torque to use. Can get codes and clear them whenever you need to. *Update* 2017-03-02 It continues to help me read codes myself or help friends with their automobiles. *update* 2018-08-16 had proven a great help. Very nice investment!
customer_reviews.author: heraldo

customer_reviews.title: This one works, Other cheaper models don't.
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this unit, I also ordered two other "mini" ELM27 readers. At the time, i had been having problems with my previous readers not connecting to my Chevrolet Spark and Chevrolet Sonic. My old reader wouldn't connect, and neither of the two other brand readers would connect. This one worked flawlessly. The conclusion... The cheaper models cost me more than twice what this one cost. This unit is well worth the 20% higher cost, because... IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Berger

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Helped me to find out what code was coming up on my car and then was able to get the part and fix it myself without having to spend a fortune at a dealer. I am a 50 year old woman and if I can do it then anyone can. Only complaint was that the software Torque is a bit difficult for me to understand exactly what it means. If I were more familiar with cars it might make more sense. But I bought this to find out the check engine light code and it did just that. Wish it would work with IOS also. Disappointed that it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 uses.
customer_reviews.text: This item stopped working the second time I used it. When it worked the first two times, it was pretty good. It then suddenly it stopped working. The red light is on but it is not connected to the cars ECU and I can’t get any information out of it. Their customer service relies to me but it wasn’t very helpful, they basically gave me troubleshooting g tips that were already part of the operating instructions. I tried to troubleshoot but it still doesn’t work. I cannot recommend this product since it stopped working very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: Screw that check engine light!
customer_reviews.text: I have a weird issue with my gas tank where it keeps sending a false positive about air in the the tank. Don't worry, I've confirmed this with my mechanic. So occasionally, after a fillup, the check engine light will come on, and with this I can confirm that it's the same damn error. Load up Torque Lite (free!), check if it's the same code, clear the log. Easy, simple, and I don't have people freaking out when they see the orange light of doom.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Idjit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  Solid quality, connects every time, how did I ever live without this before!?
customer_reviews.text: No more driving to AutoZone to check my engine codes or for some people, no more paying dealers/mechanics to read the codes. With many free apps to download to your phone (i.e., CarScanner) coupled with this device, you can do SO much more then just read codes... it gives you real-time data while you are driving in your car, all of the engine specs/stats/sensor readings, all live... all helpful in diagnosing the problem. All for only $23, WAY worth it. Thanks for such an excellent product! I have emailed all of my friends/family about this product... great gift idea!
customer_reviews.author: quik37silver

customer_reviews.title: Some long term issues.
customer_reviews.text: While this unit is not as capable as something such as a Tactrix OpenPort 2, it is great for clearing codes on the go or monitoring your car at a lower resolution (aka not as frequent in its metrics). The price is very fair and it holds a lot of diagnostic and practical utility. EDIT 23 September 2018: Seems to have stopped working after around a year. I used it for about a week every time I drove then only occasionally to check codes and monitor vehicles, but now it just shows a red light and doesn't work in any car.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Cyanide

customer_reviews.title: NO. It Does Not
customer_reviews.text: The product blurb says it will work on any vehicle manufactured since 2002. Not true, if you accept the fact that a motorhome is a vehicle. It works well on my 2015 Jeep but does not work on my 2007 Country Coach. Not only would it need an additional cable to make the physical conversion, but Country Coach uses a proprietary communication protocol that the BAFX product cannot interpret. The manufacturer needs to be more careful with theor choice of wording when describing the product. I gave it 3 stars because it does work on the Jeep.
customer_reviews.author: Brucester

customer_reviews.title: Buy one now, it will save you a bunch of money!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the OBD scanner that cost a dollar more because it had a power button. It takes forever to connect with either of my Jeeps using Dash Command or Torque. This one connects almost instantly and works with both applications. Haven't even begun to explore the things this scanner will do. I would strongly recommend this scanner to anyone who wants to keep track of their engines performance and condition. It also makes you look like car genius when you pull up, scan somebody's engine, and tell them what is going wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: A waste of time if using it with Windows
customer_reviews.text: What the product description does not say, but should say, is this, "If you plan to use this product with Windows, you will need to purchase Windows capatible software for $40 or more, and that software might or might not be compatible with your car." I tried three different OBDII programs for Windows, only one of them worked with this blue tooth scanner, and that one was not compatible with my car, even though the scanner is compatible with my car. I'll be returning this scanner and seeing if I can get a refund on the software. Overall and epic waste of time trying to get this to work with Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Who Reads

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: Have only used the product once. Connected quickly and easily to my Samsung tablet. Worked great and company representative spent a lot of time helping me find an app that provided individual cylinder information. Amazing customer service my issue had nothing to do with the function of their product yet they were willing to help and responded immediately to my inquiry. Would give 10 starts if possible!
customer_reviews.author: DjM

customer_reviews.title: Diagnose auto issues from the drivers seat
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in, download a free compatible app from play store or apple, make the Bluetooth or WiFi connection, turn on the key and you are off to a wealth of information. Really love getting the fuel trims to help with the diagnostics. No need for a $1,500.00 device. Not sure of its durability, but the info works great for diagnosing those hard issues. I bought this to figure out why a Kia Sedona had no power. It helped me eliminate injectors, fuel pump, misfires, etc... leaving one choice left - a clogged last stage catalytic converter. No need to get dirty through trial and error when the issue when it can be diagnosed sitting in the drivers seat.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W.

customer_reviews.title: Be Realistic
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing to remember is to be realistic with your expectations. Is this dongle equivalent to a $10,000 dealer diagnostic computer? No of course not. But does it work well to clear trouble codes and is it accurate? Yes. I use it with Torque Pro, what I didn't realize is there are plug ins available for various makes. That makes this dongle even more valuable. Considering the dongle and App are around $30-$35 combined? Wow can't beat it. Most recently I diagnosed a car with a bad O2 sensor. Replaced the sensor, reset the ECU and it passed smog. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Oblivieon

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy , does not work
customer_reviews.text: received the item, followed all instructions on the manual. Pairing was done fairly easy. However, I tried all the apps that the manufacturer recommended to use but the scanner could not connect to the ECM. That's the error code I got. It was supposed to connect and give me a reading within 15-60 seconds but I tried for an hour inside my car to get this thing to work. My suggestion is do not buy this product and look for one that gives you the reading within the machine itself.
customer_reviews.author: hwan kim

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This was well worth the price. It's worked with every vehicle I have tried it on. I use this with Torque (lite) and it gives real time readings for multiple sensors: air intake temp, coolant temp, mass air flow, throttle, timing advance, ect.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: It says it comes with an app, but it just suggests an app.
customer_reviews.text: This device works great. It has everything I need in an OBDII scanner for 1/5 of the price of a stand alone of the same efficacy. I was slightly disappointed that it did not actually come with an app, it just recommends Torque (lite) and doesn't even come with a code for the paid version. I made the decision between this and a device that cost half as much because it said it came with an app. It works great though so 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: joshua m

customer_reviews.title: The old ones were great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these years ago and it worked great until one day when I lent it to a friend. Then it just stopped. That being said the casing was blue on that one. These new ones won't seat all the way into the connector on any of my 3 cars. best I can tell either the middle rib is off or the pins are too wide. I asked for a replacement but it had the same problem. Guess its time to find a new brand. It gets an extra star because My first one was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.
